title: Denmark’s Copenhagen airport reopens after nearly four-hour drone disruption
byline: Copenhagen Airport, the busiest in the Nordic region, reopened early on Tuesday (Sep 23) after drone sightings halted all take-offs and landings for nearly four hours, the airport said.

title: Jimmy Kimmel show to return after suspension over Charlie Kirk comments
byline: US comedian Jimmy Kimmel will return to his late-night talk show on Tuesday after he was suspended for making jokes relating to the death of conservative influencer Charlie Kirk.

title: Justice Minister to attend first review of Committee on Enforced Disappearances in Geneva
byline: Minister of Justice and National Integration Harsha Nanayakkara is scheduled to depart for Geneva, Switzerland, on Wednesday (24), to participate in the first periodic review of Sri Lanka by the Committee on Enforced Disappearances.

title: Popular tele-drama actor Nalin Pradeep Udawela passes away aged 56
byline: Popular tele-drama actor Nalin Pradeep Udawela passed away this morning (23) at the age of 56, while receiving treatment at the Maharagama Apeksha Hospital, family sources confirmed.

title: Majestic tusker ‘Sapumal’ injured in shooting, condition critical
byline: The tusker known as ‘Sapumal’, native to the Hurulu Eco Park and Minneriya National Park, has reportedly been shot at by unknown individuals.

title: Owner of lorry found concealing drugs in Tangalle to be detained until 29 Sept.
byline: The owner of a lorry that was found concealing heroin and crystal methamphetamine (commonly known as ‘Ice’) in Seenimodara, Tangalle, yesterday (22), has been ordered to be detained for questioning.

title: Sampath Manamperi remanded
byline: Sampath Manamperi, who was detained for interrogation by the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB), has been ordered remanded in custody by the Walasmulla Magistrate’s Court today (23).

title: Trump hits Russia, backs Israel in wide-ranging UN speech
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump warned Russia on Tuesday that he is prepared to impose strong economic measures if it does not work toward ending the war in Ukraine, and rejected a global move toward recognition of a Palestinian state in a combative speech to the U.N. General Assembly.

title: FR petition against appointment of Bribery Commission DG withdrawn
byline: The Fundamental Rights petition challenging the appointment of High Court Judge Ranga Dissanayake as the Director General of the Commission to Investigate Allegations against Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC)...

title: Four-year-old child killed in road accident involving tipper truck in Ampara
byline: A four-year-old child has died following a road accident in Ampara, last evening (22).

title: Indian Navy Chief pushes for stronger defence ties with Sri Lanka
byline: Chief of the Naval Staff of India Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi on Monday laid a wreath at the Indian Peace Keeping Force (IPKF) Memorial in Colombo, “honouring the courage and supreme sacrifice of Indian soldiers” who served during the IPKF operations, the Navy Spokesperson said.

title: Fertilizer subsidy to farmers worth Rs. 200M to be provided via QR code – Minister
byline: A QR code system will be introduced in the near future to provide fertilizer subsidies to tea farmers to ensure efficiency and transparency, the Minister of Plantations and Community Infrastructure, Samantha Viddyarathna announced in Parliament today (23).

title: Two persons linked to yesterday’s Tangalle drugs seizure arrested
byline: Police have arrested two sons of an individual who died after being hospitalised from a house in Seenimodara, Tangalle, yesterday (22), where a large haul of narcotics was found in three lorries, police stated.

title: Leave of all CEB employees cancelled
byline: Leave of all employees of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has been cancelled.

title: Sri Lanka’s export earnings hit USD 11.6B in first 8 months of 2025
byline: Sri Lanka’s export sector has continued to demonstrate resilience and steady growth during the first eight months of 2025, recording total earnings of US$ 11,554.32 million.

title: Parliament to convene at 9.30am
byline: The first session of the second Parliament sitting week for September is scheduled for today (23).

title: Hong Kong braces for world’s most powerful typhoon this year
byline: Typhoon Ragasa is churning towards Hong Kong, generating winds of up to 220kmh.

title: Sri Lanka and EU sign €8 million grant agreement to support economic recovery
byline: The government signed a grant agreement with the European Union today to launch a new initiative aimed at fostering sustainable economic recovery through improved biodiversity conservation and solid waste management.

title: Drugs seized from Tangalle yesterday estimated to be worth over Rs. 9,800 million: Police
byline: The haul of narcotics seized from three lorries in Tangalle yesterday has been estimated to be worth Rs. 9,888 million, police stated.

title: UK’s Jaguar Land Rover cyber attack shutdown to hit four weeks
byline: Britain’s biggest car maker Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) is extending the closure of its factories until October 1 following a cyber attack in early September which has left its operations paralysed, and smaller suppliers struggling.

title: Sri Lanka says no immediate LNG imports from India as infrastructure lags
byline: Sri Lanka has no immediate plans to import liquefied natural gas (LNG) from India, as the required infrastructure including storage facilities is yet to be built, the country’s energy minister said on Tuesday.

title: Uni students’ protest leads to heavy traffic between Narahenpita and Borella
byline: Heavy traffic congestion has been reported from Narahenpita towards Borella owing to a protest, according to Ada Derana reporter today.

title: ICC charges Rodrigo Duterte with crimes against humanity
byline: Former Philippine president Rodrigo Duterte has been charged with crimes against humanity by the International Criminal Court (ICC).

title: Cabinet approves introduction of ‘Government SuperApp’ to streamline public services
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal to create a ‘Government SuperApp’, aimed at enabling the public to access government services through a single, unified digital platform.

title: Showers expected in several areas after 2pm today
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in the Galle, Matara, Kandy and Nuwara-Eliya districts today (23), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Sri Lanka to seek legal advice on $1 bn unpaid marine disaster claim
byline: The Sri Lankan government on Tuesday said it will consult the Attorney General on the next course of action after the owning company of a vessel failed to honour a court order directing it to pay USD 1 billion in compensation for a mishap, considered to be the worst marine disaster in the Indian Ocean.

title: Cabinet nod to renovate several state university buildings through budget allocations
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal to renovate several state universities by completing the construction of university buildings and related infrastructure facilities.

title: Joint operation launched to locate two missing fishermen in Kalpitiya seas
byline: Two individuals who set out for fishing in a boat from the Sinnakudirippu lagoon in Kalpitiya have been reported missing, police stated.

title: France formally recognises Palestinian state
byline: France has formally recognised a Palestinian state, becoming the latest in a wave of countries to take the step.

title: Belgium, Malta, Andorra, Monaco and Luxembourg recognise Palestinian state at UN meeting
byline: Belgium, Malta, Andorra, Monaco and Luxembourg have announced that they officially recognise the State of Palestine, joining a growing list of nations declaring recognition at an international conference in New York.

title: Immigration Controller Harsha Ilukpitiya sentenced to two years in prison for contempt of court
byline: The Supreme Court has sentenced Harsha Ilukpitiya, the Controller General of Immigration and Emigration, to two years of imprisonment after being found guilty of contempt of court.

title: TikTok algorithm to be retrained on US user data under Trump deal
byline: TikTok’s algorithm - the technology that determines what users see in their feed - will be copied and retrained using US user data as part of a deal to secure the app’s future in the country.

title: New Zealand woman convicted of murdering her two children and hiding bodies in suitcases
byline: A South Korean-born New Zealand woman was convicted on Tuesday of murdering her two children, whose bodies were discovered in suitcases in an abandoned storage locker, local media reported.

title: Air India crash aftermath handled ‘irresponsibly’, says court
byline: The highest court in India has strongly criticised the country’s aviation authorities for their handling of the aftermath of the Air India plane crash that killed 261 people in June.

title: Sri Lanka positioned as a unique hub for international business events - PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that “SRI LANKA MICE EXPO 2025” is a great opportunity to engage in business activities at the international level but also a valuable platform to bring the name of Sri Lanka onto the global stage.

title: 2025 Galle Dialogue to commence tomorrow
byline: The twelfth edition of the Galle Dialogue International Maritime Conference is scheduled to commence tomorrow (24).

title: Four Acting Ministers appointed during President’s visit to US and Japan
byline: Four Acting Ministers have been appointed to key ministries following the departure of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to the United States to attend the United Nations General Assembly.

title: Cause of death revealed after 2 bodies found with drugs haul at house in Tangalle
byline: The post-mortem examination on the bodies of the three persons who died under mysterious circumstances in the house, where drugs were later found in the Seenimodara area of Tangalle, has revealed that they died due to overdosing on a mix of heroin and beer.

title: ‘Kush’ worth over Rs. 50 million seized at BIA
byline: Two individuals have been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) while attempting to exit the airport with a large consignment of “Kush” cannabis worth over Rs.50 million, this morning (23).

title: Afghan boy flies from Kabul to Delhi hiding in plane’s landing gear
byline: A 13-year-old Afghan boy made a dangerous journey from Kabul to Delhi, hiding in the landing gear compartment of a Kam Air passenger plane.

title: Shah Rukh Khan wins first National Film Award for Best Actor after 3 decades
byline: After over 30 years in the film industry, Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan (SRK) finally received his first National Film Award for Best Actor.

title: X-Press Pearl Disaster: Singapore firm rejects US$1 billion Sri Lankan fine for pollution damages
byline: A Singapore-headquartered shipping company said today that it will refuse to pay Sri Lankan court-ordered damages of US$1 billion for causing that country’s worst case of environmental pollution.

title: Former Moratuwa Mayor Saman Lal Fernando granted bail
byline: Former Mayor of the Moratuwa Municipal Council Saman Lal Fernando has been granted bail by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (23), Ada Derana reporter said.

title: 35-year-old arrested for aiding and abetting shooting in Dehiwala
byline: A suspect has been arrested for allegedly aiding and abetting a shooting reported in Dehiwala on July 24, police stated.

title: New Zealand loosens path to residency for some migrants
byline: The New Zealand government said on Tuesday it was introducing two new pathways for migrants to gain residency as part of their efforts to boost the country’s economy.

title: President Dissanayake arrives in New York for UNGA session
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has arrived in New York, to attend the 80th sessions of the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA).

title: Portugal formally recognises Palestinian state, minister says
byline: Portugal’s Foreign Affairs Minister Paulo Rangel announced on Sunday that the country has now recognised the state of Palestine.

title: Woman arrested for illegal excavation in Ethimale
byline: A female suspect engaged in the illegal excavation of artifacts in the Gemunupura area, within the Ethimale Police Division, has been arrested along with excavation equipment.

title: Gazette issued declaring services related electricity supply as essential public services
byline: An Extraordinary Gazette notification has been issued by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, declaring all services connected to the supply of electricity as essential public services.

title: President to leave for US today to attend UN General Assembly
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to leave for the United States today (22).
